ARTISTIC AND SCIENTmO VALITBU(liSEL.. of, letter from re si d e n t^ joard of Education, toV'r. A. Chanbe rlai nBoard of Education, Whitehall,London, S.W. 1.11th November, 1916.(FOR THE WAR CABINET.)liy dear chamber lain,At a me ting of the Trustees of the British Museum last Saturday I was asked tc remind the Government that the Germane, not content with pillaging the public Museums and Galleries of Belgium and the other occupied territories, had carried off a number of private oollections of great artistic and scientific) value. The Trustees of the Museum hoped that the Government would take care to in3ist upon the restoration not only of the public but also of the private collections. I take it for .;:.-....ted that, when the time comes, this will be done.Yours sincerely, (Sgd.) H.A.L. FISHER.The Right Hon.J. Austen shamberlain, M.P., Offices of the War cabinet, , Whitehall Gardens, n w i .
